summary: The Nigeria Religious Freedom Accountability Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of State to designate Nigeria as a Country of Particular Concern due to religious freedom violations. It requires reports to Congress identifying Nigerian officials who promote or tolerate blasphemy laws and those who enforce them.  The bill also calls for sanctions via Executive Order 13818 and designates Boko Haram and ISIS-West Africa as Entities of Particular Concern.  Waivers are possible under specific conditions. It amends the International Religious Freedom Act, and provides definitions.
